titles.title: Samuel B. Moody Bataan Death March Compensation Act
To provide compensation for certain World War II veterans who survived the Bataan Death March and were held as prisoners of war by the Japanese.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Personnel.

bill.summary: 3/8/2001--Introduced. Samuel B. Moody Bataan Death March Compensation Act - Directs the Secretary of the military department concerned to pay certain compensation to individuals (or their survivors) who, as members of the armed forces during World War II: (1) were captured on the peninsula of Bataan or the island of Corregidor in the Philippines by Japanese forces; and (2) participated in and survived the Bataan Death March.Allows a survivor payment to be made only to an unremarried former spouse of such individual.
